me.googas.commons.time

Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.googas.commons.time.Time

  • public class Time
extends Object
    This object represents time in a simple fashion: a time Unit and a value that is given in millis. As seen this uses a custom type of unit, to use TimeUnit see ClassicTime.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Create a time instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Time

        public Time(long value,
            @NotNull
            @NotNull Unit unit)
        Create a time instance. If we want the time to be "10 seconds" we would give the value as "10" and the unit is Unit.SECONDS
        Parameters:
        value - the value of time
        unit - the unit of time

    • Method Detail

      • fromString

        public static Time fromString(@Nullable
                              @Nullable String string)
        Parse a string of time: Should look like "1s" = one second. It will take the last character of the string and get the unit using Unit.fromChar(char), the rest of the string will be parsed as a long using Long.parseLong(String)
        Parameters:
        string - the string to parse
        Returns:
        a new time instance if correctly formatted
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the string is null, if the long cannot be parsed, if the unit cannot be parsed

      • fromMillis

        public static Time fromMillis(long millis)
        Get a time instance using millis. It will create a new instance of time with
        Unit.MILLISECONDS as the provided value is given in millis
        Parameters:
        millis - the millis that will be used as the value of time.
        Returns:
        the new time instance

      • getAs

        public Time getAs(@NotNull
                  @NotNull Unit unit)
        Get this same time but in other unit. It will also change the value depending on the unit provided dividing this instance millis() with the param Unit.millis(). For example:

        If we have 60 seconds and we want to get them as Unit.MINUTES this will be the operation:

        time = (60 * 1000) / (1 * 60000) time = 1

        That is 1 minute and the time instance will have the value 1 and the unit Unit.MINUTES

        Parameters:
        unit - the unit to convert this time to
        Returns:
        the time with the new unit and value

      • ticks

        @Deprecated
public long ticks()
        Deprecated. 
        For minecraft purposes this will change the time into minecraft ticks. Deprecated use getAs(Unit) and give the unit as Unit.MINECRAFT_TICKS
        Returns:
        the time in ticks

      • millis

        public long millis()
        Get this time in millis.

        Basically multiply value with the Unit.millis()

        Returns:
        the time in millis as a long

      • nextDate

        public LocalDateTime nextDate()
        Get the next date since today using this time. Basically using nextDateMillis() it will be converted in LocalDateTime using TimeUtils.getLocalDateFromMillis(long)
        Returns:
        the next date since right now using this time instance

      • previousDate

        public LocalDateTime previousDate()
        Get the previous date since today using this time. Basically current previousDateMillis() it will be converted in LocalDateTime using TimeUtils.getLocalDateFromMillis(long)
        Returns:
        the previous date since right now using this time instance

      • nextDateOffset

        public OffsetDateTime nextDateOffset()
        Get the next offset date since today using this time. Just like nextDate() and using TimeUtils.getOffsetDateFromMillis(long)
        Returns:
        the next date since right now using this time instance

      • previousDateOffset

        public OffsetDateTime previousDateOffset()
        s Get the previous offset date since today using this time. Just like previousDate() ()} and using TimeUtils.getOffsetDateFromMillis(long)
        Returns:
        the previous date since right now using this time instance

      • toEffectiveString

        @NotNull
public @NotNull String toEffectiveString()
        Get an effective string and readable string of time.

        This means that if there is "60 seconds" the effective string will be "1 minute"

        TODO some whay of localization for this class

        Returns:
        the effective string for this time

      • toDatabaseString

        @NotNull
public @NotNull String toDatabaseString()
        Get a string that can be used in fromString(String)
        Returns:
        the string that can be saved for later parsing

      • toClassicTime

        @NotNull
public @NotNull ClassicTime toClassicTime()
        Get the time as ClassicTime. The current unit will be converted to TimeUnit using Unit.toTimeUnit() and the value (if the unit is one that is not in classic time) with getValue(TimeUnit))}
        Returns:
        this instance of time as classic time

        public long getValue(@NotNull

        Returns:

      • getValue

        public long getValue(@NotNull
                     @NotNull Unit unit)
        Just like getValue() but getting the value as another unit. First getting time instance using getAs(Unit) and getting the value of the instance
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit to get the value as
        Returns:
        the value as the given unit

      • subtract

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Time subtract(@NotNull
                                        @NotNull Time time)
        Subtract this time with another. Calculated as follows:

        time = millis() - param millis()

        Parameters:
        time - the time to subtract with
        Returns:
        the subtraction and it will not be negative it would be 0

      • sum

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Time sum(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull Time time)
        Sums this time with another one. Calculated as follows:

        time = millis() - param millis()

        Parameters:
        time - the time to sum with
        Returns:
        the result of the operation
